page.description: Create a simple, read-only active-link table.
page.syntax: L a5_Active_Link_CreateReadOnly(C table_filename ,C connectionString ,C selectStatement [,L flagAddTableToDatabse ])

argument.name: table_filename
argument.description: Filename of the .dbf table (i.e. the active-link table definition)

argument.name: connectionString
argument.description: The connection string to the remote database

argument.name: selectStatement
argument.description: The SQL query string for the remote database

argument.name: flagAddTableToDatabse
argument.description: Logical. Specify if the active-link table should be added to the current database. If you are creating a temporary active-link definition, it is much faster if you do NOT add it to the current database.

page.discussion: DescriptionCreate a simple, read-only active-link table. Used to create an ad-hoc, read-only active-link table definition.

section.description: The following code creates an an active-link table using a saved connection string to the sample Northwind database. The active-link table has just two columns, customerId and ContactName. A default browse is then opened to show the data in the active-link table.
